sentences.en: Discouraging words for those who believe that a college's job is to educate, not coddle.
sentences.cn: 对于那些认为学校的职责是教育而非溺爱的人而言,这样的话实在让人气馁.

sentences.en: Don’t coddle the child – he’s fine!
sentences.cn: 别太娇惯那孩子——他没事的！

sentences.en: She coddled her youngest son madly.
sentences.cn: 她过分溺爱她最小的儿子。

sentences.en: Teach him gently, World, but don't coddle him, because only the test of fine steel.
sentences.cn: 温柔地教导他吧, 世界, 但是不要放纵他, 因为只有烈火的考验才能炼出真钢.

sentences.en: This is also a small mouth opening to coddle the broken hand.
sentences.cn: 这也是从小饭来张口衣来伸手的娇惯坏了.

trans.tran_en: To coddle someone means to treat them too kindly or protect them too much
